website_summaries.verdict: Garmin's Edge 1000 offers top-notch navigation and full-fledged activity tracking, though you'll pay a premium for all these features.

customer_reviews.title: Best Cycling GPS I’ve used!
customer_reviews.text: The route options are unparalleled! For training you can put in a distance, say 50 Miles & it will give you 3 Round Trip routes approximately that distance to choose from. For Adventure Cyclist like myself, when searching routes it lets you set Filters on type of Roads, paved, Gravel, two lane, highway toll restrictions etc. It can Point you to key points of interest along the way hotels, food, etc. This GPS really does it all!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Frye

customer_reviews.title: Garmin at it's best
customer_reviews.text: Device does everything thing that you expect from a Garmin with a great display, speed and intuitive navigation. The additional support for Bluetooth connectivity to your cellphone, built-in Wi-Fi and LiveTrack makes this everything you need. I have mine paird with Heart Rate Monitor, Cadence Sensor, Speed Sensor and Varia Rearview Radar.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hansel

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this as a mountain bike trail GPS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a trail GPS for mountain biking. First time I used it I got lost in the desert and had to use my phone to find my way home. This thing is fine on streets but is worthless as a trail map for mountain biking Don't buy this for trails. I now use Trailforks on my iPhone for mountain bike trails and it works great. Would never buy this again and it is a ripoff inspire of the claims that it works on offload trails.
customer_reviews.author: Wiped

customer_reviews.title: Go easy the power button will eventually fail
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a refurb to replace my aging 800. I like it well enough but after using it for a while and cruising the Garmin forums the power button will eventually fail. So word to the wise. Be gentle with the power button.
customer_reviews.author: William Brannon

customer_reviews.title: Like the bigger screen
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love my new Garmin. I have not used all the features. I was already familiar with how to use the Garmin 510, so it wasn't hard to set this up. Easy to see the screen in all lighting conditions. Bigger screen easier to see with aging eyes!
customer_reviews.author: Cp

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Refurbished
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as new, run into a problem 6 months later, contacted Garmin and the told me that the unit had been refurbished. Don’t know for sure, but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product refuses to update and freezes. Seems to be a common problem.
customer_reviews.author: G. Praag

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great resolution compared to the 800. I really like when coupled with the rear radar light.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I do have the Edge 820 and earlier but the 820 was a great buy and really works great
customer_reviews.text: I have had all the Edge products and i must say i should have started with this one. I do have the Edge 820 and earlier but the 820 was a great buy and really works great, but the 1000 for this old boy can be seen a lot better. Not that it is better than the 820. Either product is great... Don't for the radar that is one of the best products i have on my bike...
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Ponder

customer_reviews.title: It seems to work well, but is not "discoverable) ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work well, but is not "discoverable) by our computers -3 different ones. I must enter ride info manually on Garmin because it will not sync.
customer_reviews.author: Truckercyclist

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: can't leave with out the trail uploaded. pushing my limits with over doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Panther

customer_reviews.title: It has great features but just wish it would work
customer_reviews.text: It cuts out in the middle of a ride, did it to me twice in one ride. Won't upload all the time, just when it wants to. It has great features but just wish it would work. Sent it back once and they sent me a refurbished one. Garmin, this is not a good product, the 800 series is what I ride with also and it has never failed.
customer_reviews.author: rickley

customer_reviews.title: While I don't think it is such a great value, it does have a lot of features ...
customer_reviews.text: While I don't think it is such a great value, it does have a lot of features and is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C Dweck

customer_reviews.title: Almost there
customer_reviews.text: Screen is smaller that I thought and battery life isn't great. I upgraded from the 800 and was glad for wifi to upload rides. Biggest problem is that I can't connect Bluetooth both to my vivoactive and the 1000 at the same time. I adapt by keeping Bluetooth off on the 1000.
customer_reviews.author: Henry L. Lazarus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cycling computer
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Works with Strava live segments. Configurable: different screens, sensors, etc. Battery life about 8 hours--a couple of hours longer would be great.
customer_reviews.author: HT

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: I have had it with Garmin. The product lasted 14 months (on a 12 month warranty). Now I have a defective on/off switch and a couple of weird splotches on the screen. They will fix it ------- if I pay $200. The Edge is fine for the general things a computer does (speed, cadence, power, etc.). Navigation and live segments are awkward (at best). The virtual partner is a complete mystery to me. So recapping, expensive, short lived, and difficult to use. My next bike computer is going to be a Wahoo Elemnt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wait until bugs are sorted out
customer_reviews.text: Issues with Bluetooth connection dropping. Touchscreen locks and only way to reactivate is to turn device off. Supplied maps not unlocked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad firmware...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this device yet. Garmin needs to improve its firmware a lot before it gets closer to Edge 800 or 810. Despite the bigger and better resolution screen, its usability is not good. The stupid Virtual Partner can't be turned off, and as a result, it spends much more battery. The elevation screen became useless since you can never know you position on the elevation profile. Moreover, the backlit is weak and the navigation data sometimes become crazy. So, I regret having purchased this device.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Marcio S A Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, FAST delivery! Just what we needed for RV travel!
customer_reviews.author: Big A train

customer_reviews.title: This one works!
customer_reviews.text: Long story short. After purchasing a 820 edge and it crashing when I upgraded the software I returned it fir an exchange. The second 820 did the same thing. This was my third attempt at a new Garmin. The 1000 is working and all the updates went without a glitch.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Finley

customer_reviews.title: This is not for me...
customer_reviews.text: I can't get an accurate heart rate, the screen freezes too often and I missed the return date by a day.....
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Glass

customer_reviews.title: Great Cycling GPS Computer from Garmin
customer_reviews.text: The best large GPS bike computer. User interface is due for an update but this computer still cannot be beat. Easy to pair with accessories like power meter, phone, etc. I love the Shimano D-Fly remote capability that allows you to change screens with the buttons on the top of Di2 levers. Wireless uploads work great if you figure it out once and then never touch it again. Your elevation gain will be 15% less than your riding pals using the Edge 500 / 520 units so just ride harder.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Landon

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough
customer_reviews.text: Wifi doesn't work. Battery doesn't last an all day ride. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P Williams

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy attachment to the bike
customer_reviews.text: The device fell off after the first bump. What you need to know is that the bike mount that comes with the device is really bad. You'll need to shell out extra for a good mount.
customer_reviews.author: O. Khouri

customer_reviews.title: I like everything about this device except for the poor battery ...
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this device except for the poor battery life. It only lasts around 100 miles. I had the 800 previously which lasted around 180 miles when using the map and course routing. I suppose it's because of the larger screen.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D. Pettis

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well and looks very nice on my bike
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. So helpful to have all different display options. Works extremely well and looks very nice on my bike. I was reluctant to spend this much on a cycle computer, but couldn't find the Edge 1000 anywhere for less so I coughed up the bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

customer_reviews.title: great upgrade from my 705
customer_reviews.text: great upgrade from my 705. initial problems were resolved when I upgraded the flash. NOTE: DO NOT upgrade the flash on the GPS unless you have a reason to, and then check the message boards before doing so. It seems Garmin has a history of updates breaking things and you cannot go backwards.
customer_reviews.author: srq fl

customer_reviews.title: Great, except for battery life...
customer_reviews.text: Like the map feature, and ability to follow courses during gravel races. Unfortunately, the battery life is terrible. I only get 6-7 hours before the unit dies. And that's with any sensors (Garmin radar or remote, for example) disabled.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money -- if you ride a lot of miles
customer_reviews.text: The added screen, profiles and very fast recording (including nearly no delay in power meter recalibration) are phenomenal. Battery might run out after 90 miles of guided, high "light" use -- not an issue with some setting tweaks. The virtual racer and segment timing are nice extras to watch on sections of a big ride. (full integration with Strava segments would be great -- so work is required to set up your own segment times)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Cycling Compter
customer_reviews.text: This cycling computer added new dimensions to cycling. Yesterday helped me get back out of complicated neighborhood with out having to back track. Have not even begun to explore advanced features like turn by turn routing, Shipping time was and the price were both excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife so she could follow a route without my guidance on tour, replaceable memory card so you can load world maps. I already own one and would't ride without it, waiting for the newer version!
customer_reviews.author: KAL-TECH

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product. It keeps track of all my riding-related ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. It keeps track of all my riding-related data and keeps me from having to carry cue sheets for longer rides. Would highly recommend this device to anyone who is serious about their training for cycling. I might add that it is compatible with several cycling apps as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: This is THE bike computer if you want the best.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best bike computer on the market. I have previously owned Garmin's 305, and 510, and now the 1000. Each one gets better. All my GPS toys ( I have 12) are Garmin. I personally feel overall they make the best GPS products. But then to be fair Garmin is all I have ever owned. The transfer if data from the 1000 to the Garmin App is flawless with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JohnT

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Computer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. About the 10th Garmin bike computer I have owned over the years. This one is head and shoulders above the others in terms of features, ability to read in bright daylight, etc. Expensive, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard V.

customer_reviews.title: Display many ride metrics on 4 screens.
customer_reviews.text: Great cycle computer. Half the price of Garmin 1030 with same features, except shorter battery life (~10 hours).
customer_reviews.author: James Polisini

customer_reviews.title: With the upgrade software this new Garmin 1000 works great had a original had some bugs
customer_reviews.text: With the upgrade software this new Garmin 1000 works great had a original had some bugs. The new software and Garmin Edge 1000 works Great. Best bikeGPS out there.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Hughson

customer_reviews.title: This unit sometime freezes up while using and then you ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit sometime freezes up while using and then you can't restart while out on the road cause it needs to be hooked up to a Computer in order to reset. This is a bummer cause if you where recording data when on a ride when it freezes up you can't capture the rest of your ride.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Like brand new
customer_reviews.text: Used but it worked perfectly and came packed like it was brand new
customer_reviews.author: Greg Dion

customer_reviews.title: Love the color and especially loves that it uploads my ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and especially loves that it uploads my rides wirelessly and automatically (a setting choice). I do have to charge it a little more, but I keep the brightness on high.
customer_reviews.author: Linda James

customer_reviews.title: Too many problems
customer_reviews.text: I boughted almost a year ago, at begining it worked perfectly but I had the following issues: 1. Lock Sreen issue ( I think is fixed) 2. Connection with the Iphone 5s work for about 2 hrs after that at some point of time connection is lost and LiveTrack stoped 8 months after I boughted the edge stop receiving charge (battery went dead) I couldn't charge it from any source and different cables. Garmin give me a new one and after 2 months I am experience the same issue again, and now is not on warranty...!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Oswaldo

customer_reviews.title: Just tried the Varia system out and would recommend for country roads
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from a Garmin edge 520. I needed the larger screen, and wanted to pair with the VARIA tail light/radar. Has all of the functionality and touch screen from the 520 plus is bigger and brighter. Just tried the Varia system out and would recommend for country roads, not especially helpful in very busy areas.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F

customer_reviews.title: worth it to me
customer_reviews.text: a little pricey but worth it to me for the phone notifications. I did have to do a factory reset after the initial firmware upgrade before I could pair my iPhone completely to get notifications
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike computer! Don't get it confused with the Edge 1000 Explore for $50 cheaper, not the same item.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Tonka

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: My expectation was that if I use cycling map, and bicycle activity profile that Edge 1000 will find the shortest bicycle path from point A to B. However it finds shortest path on normal road used by cars. For that I can use my existing car GPS. It is possible that I do not know how to do the settings but I asked Garmin and never got any response. Therefore low rating. Also search is flaky, it will not find the street when I am on cycle map.
customer_reviews.author: PeterV

product_meta.title: Garmin Edge 1000 Color Touchscreen GPS
product_meta.description:
Style:Base Model

BIKE COMPUTER FOR COMPETING, CONNECTING AND NAVIGATING
 * In-ride competitions through Garmin Connect™ segments
 * On-road or off-road navigation and points of interest with preloaded Garmin Cycle Map 
 * Input a distance and choose from up to 3 round-trip ride options
 * Instant uploads to Garmin Connect™ Mobile to analyze and share
 * Connected features¹: incoming call and text alerts², live tracking, sending/receiving courses, social media sharing, weather



Whether you are riding to improve your own personal best or see where you stand against the pros, Edge 1000 lets you connect, compare and compete. Turn every ride into a race by competing on Garmin Connect segments and seeing real-time results on your Edge, including alerts for segment start and finish and leaderboard rankings. The segments feature keeps you motivated and helps you push for continual improvement.

OWN THE ROAD
Along with in-ride challenges and connected features, Edge 1000 offers advanced bike-specific navigation and mapping capabilities. The preloaded Garmin Cycle Map includes OSM (Open Street Map) content with routable road and bike paths, elevation data, points of interest and address search. Mapping data is stored onboard the Edge, so your access to navigation and performance capabilities isn’t dependent on cell coverage, and map updates are free.

KNOW WHERE TO GO
Now you can explore more, on and off road, thanks to this device’s round-trip routing feature. Simply enter how far you want to ride, and Edge 1000 calculates up to 3 cycling-friendly routes. You can even review the elevation profiles before making your selection. It also offers a new route planner capability that allows you to create routes directly on the Edge 1000 using the map, POI and segments you’ve downloaded from Garmin Connect. Again, you can preview the elevation profile of your custom route before you roll. If you do get off course or want to end your ride sooner, Edge can always guide you back to start or calculate the most direct route and provide turn-by-turn directions to get you back.

AT YOUR FINGERTIPS
Edge 1000 features a 3-inch high-resolution color touchscreen display with dual orientation. It has an ambient light sensor that automatically adjusts the screen brightness to changing light conditions to improve visibility. Unlike your smartphone, the display is optimized to work with gloves and in the rain³. You can customize your training pages with up to 10 data fields and use activity profiles to allow for easy transitions when you switch cycling activity, such as road, mountain or touring.

ADVANCED PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS
Edge 1000 is compatible with ANT+™ sensors, including speed, cadence, heart rate and compatible weight scale. It’s the first Garmin bike computer that integrates with Shimano Di2 electronic shifting systems4 to display your current gear on the screen. Edge 1000 is also compatible with ANT+ power meters, including Vector™, our unique pedal-based power meter that measures total power, left/right balance and cadence. A preloaded power-based workout on Edge 1000 allows you to calculate your functional threshold power (FTP), from which you can base your power training zones. The 1000 offers a training calendar and is compatible with advanced workouts, which you can plan, schedule and upload from Garmin Connect.

SMARTPHONE CONNECTIVITY
When paired with your smartphone and the Garmin Connect™ Mobile app, Edge 1000 offers a suite of connected features, including live tracking, incoming call and text alerts, social media sharing, weather, wireless uploads and sending/receiving courses and segments. As soon as your ride is complete, the data can be automatically sent to Garmin Connect via Bluetooth® or Wi-Fi®. This lets you stay connected and instantly share the details of your ride with friends, family and social media contacts. LiveTrack allows your friends and family to follow your races and training activities in real time. Invite followers using email or social media, so they can view your live data on a Garmin Connect tracking page. Once they get your email invite, they can click to follow and see your stats and location on the map.

¹When paired with your Bluetooth® or Bluetooth Smart Ready phone; contact your service provider to verify if your phone is compatible. The Bluetooth word mark and logos are registered trademarks owned by Bluetooth SIG, INC. Wi-Fi® is a registered trademark of Wi-Fi Alliance Corporation.

²iPhone® 4s or later. iPhone is a trademark of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.

³Water-rated to IPX7; ANT+ wireless connectivity does not work underwater.

4Compatible with Shimano Di2 electronic shifting systems with Shimano D-Fly Data Management function.
feature_bullets: Large 3.0" Display - See what you need with ease, and stay focused on the road ahead. Edge 1000 uses a glove-friendly, touchscreen Display that adjusts automatically for low-light areas, such as shade and tunnels
Segments - Turn every ride into a race by competing on Garmin Connect Segments and seeing Real-time results on your Edge 1000, including alerts for segment start and finish and leaderboard rankings
Smart Notifications - See your text, email and call Notifications from your iPhone 4s or later while riding

Bike-Specific Navigation -Navigate the best cycling roads with preloaded maps and points of interest (POIs). Round-trip Routing makes it easy to explore new roads, and Route Planner allows you to create routes using the map or POIs directly on the device
Includes: Edge 1000, extended out-front mount, standard mount, preloaded maps, tether, USB cable, manuals
